[~shreymehrotra] You can edit that entry in pom to use "0.5.2" . 
This has been fixed in 1.0 release of hive, the vote just passed yesterday, and the release announcement should be sent very soon. 1.0 release is essentially 0.14 + bug fixes + removal of hiveserver1 . It is a very stable release, you might want to use that.
This is bad. Hive should not depend on SNAPSHOT releases.  Why do we keep doing this?

bq. Hive should not depend on SNAPSHOT releases.
I agree. This was an oversight in 0.14 release. HIVE-8933 has added a check in build to detect this.
